page.title: 06CROFTING IN THE PAST
page.content: INLAND FROM THE VILLAGE OF SHIELDAIG IS A LARGE WALLED AREA OF LAND CALLED 'THE CROFT'. IN THE PAST PEOPLE WHO LIVED IN THE VILLAGE WOULD HAVE A STRIP OF THIS LAND FOR CULTIVATION AND GRAZING. YOU CAN STILL SEE THE PILES OF STONES CLEARED FROM THE STRIPS, AND PILED AT THE SIDES. DURING THE WINTER COWS AND SHEEP WOULD GRAZE ON THIS LAND. AT AN APPOINTED DATE IN THE SPRING THE ANIMALS WOULD BE REMOVED TO GRAZING OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE, AND VEGETABLES, ESPECIALLY POTATOES WOULD BE PLANTED. SOME OF THE LAND WOULD BE IN HAY. IN THE SUMMER THE WOMEN AND CHILDREN WOULD TAKE THE COWS TO THE SUMMER HUTS OR 'SHIELINGS' AND LIVE AT THE HIGHER GRAZING LAND. THE MEN WOULD STAY AND WORK ON THE CROFT.
